hedline.hl1: 2 Washington Officers Hurt in Drive-by Shooting

abstract.p: Two off-duty District of Columbia police officers are slightly injured in drive-by shooting in Manhattan; David Mosely and Charles Elliott belong to law enforcement motorcycle club Wild Pigs and had attended local motorcycle rally (S)

block.p: Two off-duty District of Columbia police officers were slightly injured in a drive-by shooting in Manhattan early yesterday, the police said.

Officer Joseph Cavitolo, a spokesman for the Police Department, said Officers David Mosely and Charles Elliott were at 10th Avenue and West 16th Street about 4 a.m. when someone in a passing sport utility vehicle fired several shots at them. Officer Mosely, 30, was struck once in the buttocks. Officer Elliott, 33, was grazed in the arm. Both were treated at St. Vincent's Hospital and Medical Center and released.
Two off-duty District of Columbia police officers were slightly injured in a drive-by shooting in Manhattan early yesterday, the police said.

Officer Joseph Cavitolo, a spokesman for the Police Department, said Officers David Mosely and Charles Elliott were at 10th Avenue and West 16th Street about 4 a.m. when someone in a passing sport utility vehicle fired several shots at them. Officer Mosely, 30, was struck once in the buttocks. Officer Elliott, 33, was grazed in the arm. Both were treated at St. Vincent's Hospital and Medical Center and released.

The police said the officers were members of a law enforcement motorcycle club called the Wild Pigs. Officer Cavitolo said the men had attended a motorcycle rally in New Jersey on Sunday and then went to Manhattan.
